Generation I.Red: An enigmatic Pok é mon that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: An enigmatic Pok é mon that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.
Generation I.Yellow: As long as the center section is unharmed, it can grow back fully even if it is chopped to bits.
Generation I.Stadium: It is capable of growing back any portion of its body that is cut off. At night, the center core glows with a red light.

Generation II.Gold: At night, the center of its body slowly flickers with the same rhythm as a human heartbeat.
Generation II.Silver: Even if its body is torn, it can regenerate as long as the glowing central core remains intact.
Generation II.Crystal: When the stars twinkle at night, it floats up from the sea floor, and its body's center core flickers.
Generation II.Stadium 2: At night, the center of its body slowly flickers with the same rhythm as a human heartbeat. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Even if its body is torn, it can regenerate as long as the glowing central core remains intact. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Staryu 's center section has an organ called the core that shines bright red. If you go to a beach toward the end of summer, the glowing cores of these Pok é mon look like the stars in the sky.
Generation III.Sapphire: Staryu apparently communicates with the stars in the night sky by flashing the red core at the center of its body. If parts of its body are torn, this Pok é mon simply regenerates the missing pieces and limbs.
Generation III.Emerald: It gathers with others in the night and makes its red core glow on and off with the twinkling stars. It can regenerate limbs if they are severed from its body.
Generation III.FireRed: It appears in large numbers by seashores. At night, its central core flashes with a red light.
Generation III.LeafGreen: An enigmatic Pok é mon that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.

Generation IV.Diamond: If its body is torn, it can grow back if the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.
Generation IV.Pearl: If its body is torn, it can grow back if the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.
Generation IV.Platinum: If its body is torn, it can grow back if the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.
Generation IV.HeartGold: At night, the middle of its body slowly flickers with the same rhythm as a human heartbeat.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Even if its body is torn, it can regenerate as long as the glowing central core remains intact.

Generation V.Black: If its body is torn, it can grow back if the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.
Generation V.White: If its body is torn, it can grow back if the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.
Generation V.Black 2: As long as its red core remains, it can regenerate its body instantly, even if it's torn apart.
Generation V.White 2: As long as its red core remains, it can regenerate its body instantly, even if it's torn apart.

Generation VI.X: Even if its body is torn, it can regenerate as long as the glowing central core remains intact.
Generation VI.Y: It appears in large numbers by seashores. At night, its central core flashes with a red light.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Staryu's center section has an organ called the core that shines bright red. If you go to a beach toward the end of summer, the glowing cores of these Pokémon look like the stars in the sky.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Staryu apparently communicates with the stars in the night sky by flashing the red core at the center of its body. If parts of its body are torn, this Pokémon simply regenerates the missing pieces and limbs.

Generation VII.Sun: Large numbers of these Pokémon make their home at the seaside. At night, a strange red glow radiates from the center of their bodies.
Generation VII.Moon: This Pokémon gets nibbled on by Lumineon and others. Thanks to its red core, it regenerates fast, so it's unconcerned by their snack attacks.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: In many places, there are folktales of stardust falling into the ocean and becoming Staryu.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: No number of injuries can bother Staryu. Its amazing regenerative powers return it to its previous state in half a day!
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: As long as the center section is unharmed, this Pokémon can grow back fully even if it is chopped to bits.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: As long as the center section is unharmed, this Pokémon can grow back fully even if it is chopped to bits.

Generation VIII.Sword: If you visit a beach at the end of summer, you'll be able to see groups of Staryu lighting up in a steady rhythm.
Generation VIII.Shield: Fish Pokémon nibble at it, but Staryu isn't bothered. Its body regenerates quickly, even if part of it is completely torn off.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: If Staryu's body is damaged, it will regenerate as long as the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: If Staryu's body is damaged, it will regenerate as long as the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.
